titles.full: The Great War and Modern Memory

summaries.short: Season Three Premiere. Retired detective Wayne Hays revisits key moments from a haunting murder/kidnapping case from 35 years earlier.
summaries.full: Season Three Premiere. The disappearance of a young Arkansas boy and his sister in 1980 triggers vivid memories and enduring questions for retired detective Wayne Hays, who worked the case 35 years ago with his then-partner Roland West. What started as a routine case becomes a long journey to dissect the crime and make sense of it.

summaries.short: Two suspects emerge as the Purcell missing-children case heats up in the rural town of West Finger, AR.
summaries.full: Hays looks back at the aftermath of the 1980 Purcell case in West Finger, AR, including possible evidence left behind at the Devil's Den. As attention focuses on two conspicuous suspects--Brett Woodard, a solitary vet and trash collector, and Ted LaGrange, an ex-con with a penchant for children--the parents of the missing kids, Tom and Lucy Purcell, receive a cryptic note.

summaries.short: Season Two Finale. Frank, Ray and Ani weigh their options as Caspere's killer and the scope of corruption are revealed.

summaries.short: New evidence surfaces for Hays and Roland, ten years after the Purcell crimes occurred.
summaries.full: Hays recalls his early romance with Amelia, as well as some cracks in their relationship that surfaced after they married and had children. Ten years after the Purcell crimes took place, new evidence emerges, giving Hays a second chance to vindicate himself and the investigation.
